notes.text: Setting up new dev project with the pluralsight project by Joe Eames on the mean stack.
Created new directory...npm installed --save express jade
[git init] to kick of git for source controll
created a new .gitignore file in webstorm [git status] to see what files are tracked
added .idea and node_modules to the gitignore file to keep them out of source control
[git status] again and the files have been removed from gits purview
[git add -A] to add to staging and [git commit -m 'initial commit']
[git remote add origin https://github.com/patterncoder/tipminer.git] to add the github repo I created on the site
[git push -u origin master] entered the username and password
install client side dependencies with bower I chose to install globally could have installed as just scoped to project would have been [npm install bower --save-dev]
[npm install bower -g] executed successfully geez..lot of stuff with bower
now need to setup folder structure added two top level folder server(node files and views, partials etc this is because partials will be processed with jade) and public(css, angular etc)
added a bowerrc file to tell where to place client side dependencies
[bower init]...answered several questions no to all except yes to private..also set to node module type(not sure if this was correct)
[bower install jquery --save]...[bower install toastr --save]...[bower install angular angular-route angular-resource --save]
the above commands added a dependency node to the bower.json file also because of the .bowerrc file it added the installed files in the public/vendor folder...pretty clean so far
added server.js file...and started coding according to the 'creating the node application ' module in the pluralsight video.  this is where watchers were discussed for webstorm.
added server/views folder and an index.jade file
started up server succesfully but could not browse to it...fixed it..had doctype html and is should just be doctype at the top of the jade file
[npm install nodemon -g] for the ability make changes without stopping node each time
added some more code to server.js and [npm install stylus --save]
everything is working at this point.
committed changes to this point...pushed to github...deployed to azure...didn't work...think it has to do with ports
added an server/includes folder and a layout.jade file in the folder...added a public/css folder
bower installed bootstrap for project then copied the bootstrap.css file to the public/css folder
npm intalled globally the stylus module so that the stylus file watcher would work
modified the index.jade and created layout.jade and scripts.jade this packaged up the scripts and process the site.styl file
fixed azure after modifying how the port was set and now it runs correctly
added public/app folder and added app.js file and started the angular aspect of the app
going to setup angular partials to use jade...added a /server/views/partials folder and added a main.jade file called from the mainCtrl
added ng-view and ng-app directives to index.jade and layout.jade respectively
getting ready to add mongo...npm install mongoose --save
added code according to the video and got it working!
next part is the heroku deployment which includes adding a mongolab db
made a Procfile that heroku reads to tell it to launch node, also modified the package.json to have an engines key that has the node and npm versions specified
